an1.258-267:4.1: “The foremost of my laywomen in first going for refuge is Sujātā Seniyadhītā.
an1.258-267:5.1: … as a donor is Visākhā, Migāra’s mother.
an1.258-267:6.1: … who is very learned is Khujjuttarā.
an1.258-267:7.1: … who dwell in love is Sāmāvatī.
an1.258-267:9.1: … who give good things is Suppavāsā Koliyadhītā.
an1.258-267:10.1: … who care for the sick is the laywoman Suppiyā.
an1.258-267:11.1: … who have the experiential confidence is Kātiyānī.
an1.258-267:12.1: … who are intimate is the householder Nakula’s mother.
an1.258-267:13.1: … whose confidence is based on oral transmission is the laywoman Kāḷī of Kuraraghara.”
